website_summaries.verdict: Those who want the convenience of a physical keyboard will appreciate the BlackBerry's design.
pros: Allows for adding a microSD card to gain 256GB of storage capacity
Dual-rear camera provides extra photography features and 4K video recording option
Front-facing camera carries 8 megapixels of resolution
Handy keyboard along lower portion of phone
cons: Screen measures only 4.5 inches, as physical keyboard occupies a lot of space

website_summaries.verdict: If you rely on an older BlackBerry phone, the BlackBerry Key2 is a worthy upgrade, but it will frustrate people switching from all-touch phones, despite some winning extras.
pros: The BlackBerry Key2 improves on the KeyOne across the board
Outdoor daytime photos are crisp and bright, and portrait mode works well
Keyboard shortcuts that open other apps are fantastic, as is a programmable convenience key
cons: Despite larger buttons, the Key2's QWERTY keyboard still feels cramped
The Key2 is laggy, and suffers from weak low light photography and capacitive navigation buttons that get in the way

website_summaries.verdict: The Key2 will thrill BlackBerry devotees with a great little keyboard and more privacy control than you'll get on other Android smartphones.
pros: Nice physical keyboard with powerful shortcut key

customer_reviews.title: The best option for keyboard lovers
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty much the best option for those of us who want a physical keyboard. The keys themselves are as good as any Blackberry ever did (even though this is a TCL device) and Android 8 runs great on the processor and with the 6GB RAM -- much better than the KeyOne last year. As others have said, the battery is outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: HM

customer_reviews.title: iPhone 7 convert! Couldn't be happier!
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone! Went from an iPhone 7 to this to get back to a keyboard. I travel frequently and run a business with over 200 employees. Multitasking along with frequent typing or having to work with the Microsoft apps are 1000x easier with this device. The only downside is my iPhone enabled friends complaints that my messages show up green. Their problem, not mine. It took a few days to get reacquainted with typing but it's smooth sailing! Easy to transfer everything from Apple than it used to be! My T-Mobile calling worked from setup with zero issues. I have better reception than the iPhone as well.
customer_reviews.author: Mark K

customer_reviews.title: came quickly
customer_reviews.text: tricky to change from Chinese to English but I got it set up and the phone works great
customer_reviews.author: Taylor H.

customer_reviews.title: This phone was made in India and is not supported by BB USA
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Key 2 through the BB USA website link. The technicians at BB told me to make sure that I used their link on the BB website to Amazon and Best Buy because it would take me to the USA warranted product. Well, Best Buy no longer sells the Key 2 and this Amazon link sells the Key2 made in India and not supported by BB USA. The AC plugs are for Indian outlets (two round prongs) and the wireless is configured for Indian networks. They may work on the US wireless systems, but I an not willing to take that chance on a new expensive phone. I returned this phone.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Best phone I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Best phone I've ever owned. The keyboard is awesome. The only concern I had was the screen size but it has proven not to be an issue at all. It feels like a very high quality phone and I've benchmarks 66 words per minute on it without any autocorrect or autocomplete. The camera is decent and I use it for tutorials I write online for automotive applications. The whole thing feels very high quality, is very fast, and allows me to get a lot more work done while on the go. I've had it for 2 months now and can't speak highly enough about it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel P.

customer_reviews.title: Blackberry Key2 Black
customer_reviews.text: Physical keyboard phones are a niche and by means nowhere near the most popular phone but this one brings back the matter finish keys that are spacial like all blackberry fans are used to. Will more memory and speed, especially in black, is a definite improvement over the KeyOne and I will be loving it until the K3 becomes available.
customer_reviews.author: blueyestm

customer_reviews.title: Not working
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when it first came out. It worked well for a bit but just stopped working. Won't turn on. Beyond bummed but the even worse is the customer service that has not gotten back to me. I don't have a key number they need and as a result are not being helpful. I could get the number if I could turn it on but alas. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne M

customer_reviews.title: Good phone, good battery life, just overpriced
customer_reviews.text: If this phone was $500, I think that would be fine, but at $650 I can't recommend it. You could buy a Pixel 2 new for that price and in no way does the processor or display or camera on this phone compare with that phone. the Key2 excels in battery life and security features and its the only modern phone u can get with a physical keyboard yes, but it is still overpriced i think. It's a mid range phone selling for flagship prices.
customer_reviews.author: Tong Zou

customer_reviews.title: Screen Locks every few seconds
customer_reviews.text: I am faithful blackberry user and been one for 16 years and i just could never past the screen lock with this phone. The screen locks every two-three seconds no matter what application is running. Even when am typing an email or sending a message. Sometimes it locks up as soon as i finish typing the passcode. I hope this was just a faulty phone but i will be shopping for a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Murang'a's Finest

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smartphone with GREAT keyboard!
customer_reviews.text: I am sooooo sad that BlackBerry is going to stop making smartphones. It is a shame that such an excellent product line was allowed to die from poor marketing by the parent corporation. The BlackBerry keyboard allows you to type 2x-3x faster than on any iPhone with far fewer errors. The proprietary security software is tops. I wish Samsung would make a smartphone with a keyboard like a BlackBerry......
customer_reviews.author: Alan in NY

customer_reviews.title: A BlackBerry Steve Jobs Would've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Great phone. As a physical keyboard devotee, I was thrilled when I could finally live in Android app heaven but still have my PKB. Best keyboard ever -- better than any of the old BlackBerrys. I turned off the capacitative function of the keyboard (though people rave coz its a virtual 'mouse' (very cool), but that's just finicky me. The silver version gets gasps and wows from people when I'm in the grocery store line or between classes. Most hip phone in the universe. Why, iPhone Excess owners? Because unlike your mass iPolitburo phones, this one stands on its own. Seriously: Be you. The real you.
customer_reviews.author: Brityank

customer_reviews.title: More RAM, Best Android OS yet...
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this new BlackBerry phone running the much improved Android Oreo (8.1). Lots of RAM, runs EVERY Android App (with extra security from BlackBerry), and even a optimized BlackBerry keyboard. Probably their best phone since the heyday days. Upgraded from KeyOne - and since I used many Apps simultaneously, we'll worth the upgrade!!
customer_reviews.author: Garth Ancier

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this seller
customer_reviews.text: The phone is fine, although this version is made in India and North America Blackberry will not honor the warranty. I tried to call the manufacturer in India as my space key is acting funny just after buying this from Amazon through this seller. I cannot get through. Hoping to get a helping a hand from the seller, I instead get a reply that they will not do anything for me after 90 days have elapsed from purchase. That's it. No information about the international warranty, no guidance at all. I will never buy anything from BuySpry again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: DOGS--T!
customer_reviews.text: I've been a blackberry customer for 20 years. Never again. Now I see why they occupy the bottom rung in this space. This is the biggest piece of garbage I've ever experienced. 5 months after purchasing, the space-bar took a dump on me. NO, I never dropped it! The button just wore out. After trying several "customer service" options, the 1 year warranty doesn't cover spit! They want to send me some refurbished garbage instead of a new phone like I purchased. I could understand if I had the phone for 2 years or something like that, but my phone is practically brand new! Going to see if Amazon prime can do anything, if not, AMEX to do a chargeback!
customer_reviews.author: John Kouri

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE- misleading description of product- NOT for use in the United States
customer_reviews.text: As a die-hard BlackBerry user for the past 20 years, I immediately noticed the keyboard was glitchy and the space bar didn't work! After a call to BlackBerry Support, their diagnostics and IMEI check revealed the phone was produced for use in the Caribbean Market, not the U.S. The BlackBerry rep advised the only remaining authorized dealer for their products is GoTalkUSA.com.
customer_reviews.author: MA S.

customer_reviews.title: Was sent non-US variant.
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware: I purchased this item new less than a week ago, fulfilled by Amazon. Was sent model number BBF100-6. This is a non-US variant that will not receive any kind of manufacturer warranty in the US and I have my doubts it will receive security updates in the US, either. Listing was described as BBF100-2 (the US variant). Very disappointed in Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: wish keyboard was bigger.. but its a BEAUTIFUL phone
customer_reviews.text: this phone is a looker... if you download the Nova Launcher and make the look of it minimal, it really stands out amongst all the black slabs full of ugly colorful app grids. i wanted a phone for communication- email, messages, phone, calendar. i purposely have as few apps as possible. if you want a minimal slick phone this is it... but dont use the default launcher.
customer_reviews.author: tensacross

customer_reviews.title: Still love this phone 13months later
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone! So hard to find one w a real keyboard these days. I didn't even know BlackBerry still existed, but was glad to find they do & that they are making good phones!
customer_reviews.author: BAH

customer_reviews.title: Incredible Phone
customer_reviews.text: Depending on what apps I use sometimes I can go more than 24 hours before the next charge. The charge time is very fast. The processor is extremely fast. The key board took a bit to get use to but now I remember why I fell in love with the BLACKBERRY in the first place. If you once was in love with BB and have moved on to other platforms I just might like the KEY2. Remember it is a Android so you will be able to use all the apps found on Google store.
customer_reviews.author: D. C Owens

customer_reviews.title: NO WIFI CALLING ON T-MOBILE!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this phone because I was led to believe it was wifi calling enabled. I travel worldwide and this is an essential feature. It is NOT wifi calling enabled on T-Mobile and it is not going to be anytime soon. Other than that, a fantastic phone. Solid the build and love the keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Longe

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this phone
customer_reviews.text: BlackBerry hardware and Android operating system are a match made in heaven. It does everything it is supposed to do well and quickly. I have had 3 other BlackBerry phones in the past - the last had some android operating system features, but not all so it gave me a glimpse of what was to come. I am a very happy user - still whipping through emails and texts with my keyboard and now also using any and all apps to my heart's content..
customer_reviews.author: Shari Altman

customer_reviews.title: It is a good phone, but I would like to see a Priv-2
customer_reviews.text: I like the Key-2 phone, but honestly I would like to see an improved Priv-2 (just a better keyboard and battery life will do). The Priv concept is amazing. There are couple of things that bother me with the Key-2: the size of the touch screen (small) and the camera (not superb). I still went with it, because I am a loyal BlackBerry-ist and I can't stand the virtual keyboards.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just got my new black BLACKBERRY Key2 !!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box -- whoa!! sleek! The Caddy of phones. Kevlar on the back really helps to hold onto it! SO many shortcuts and helps built in -- like the Convenience Button on the side! I can swipe right over the keyboard, too! Battery lasts the whole day, and THEN some!! Extra-tight security in "the Locker," to do banking -- really important, to me. Super-D-duper!!!
customer_reviews.author: Paula Dwyer

customer_reviews.title: Love It!!!
customer_reviews.text: Definitely and upgrade from the Keyone. The keyboard is bigger without sacrificing any of the 4.5 inch screen. The battery is better than the Keyone (although the keyone's battery lasted all day). The phone processes much faster.
customer_reviews.author: Richards

customer_reviews.title: Battery life not so good - otherwise, great phone.
customer_reviews.text: I would give it a five except the battery life on my phone sucks which is very disappointing since many of the reviews said that the battery life was amazing. Maybe I received a bad device? If so, I am hoping that I can send it back for a new one. Other than that, I am a true blackberry fan and after years of having switched to iPhone and using it, I am happy to back to my original love, the crackberry. No other phone makes life much better for me than this device.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 BlackBerry Key2, My wifes phone powered off at 50% battery life and never turned back on. No water damage, called BlackBerry customers service. And they ask for a $600 deposit to be held once they get the phone. Or they will have you ship your phone and it takes 7-10 business days to check the phone. Highly Dissapointed
customer_reviews.author: ClI

customer_reviews.title: Transition from Blackberry Classic OS 10 to Blackberry Android
customer_reviews.text: Transferring files from one operations system to another was a concern. However, the process went smoothly using the Blackberry Content Transfer App I downloaded free from Blackberry World. Learning curve for Android wasn't as difficult as I thought. Obtaining new Sim card directly from T-Mobile and activating it was no problem. The quality of the BB Key 2 meets my expectations. I would make the purchase again if I had to do it over.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product that does its job well.
customer_reviews.text: The main feature is of course the physical keyboard, and it is excellent. The built-in version of Cangjie (Chinese IME) is not that good, but it is easy to install a third-party version and use that with the physical keyboard as well. The battery life is impressive, and I've found myself using the split-screen feature more often than I expected. The one complaint I have is that the menu that lets me cut, copy, paste, select all, etc. sometimes appears and doesn't go away until I select one of the alternatives. It can be annoying, but it's very minor.
customer_reviews.author: Víkþórr Veggiss Berurjóðr

customer_reviews.title: This phone screams I am a business man & I am the boss around here.
customer_reviews.text: My title is self explanatory. This phone is not for any person around there. This phone is for business. This phone gets stuff done. Quickly, easy and without any bs. People will look you and the first thing that they will tell you: Is that a blackberry? If you want something different, something that sticks out of the crowd, and want to get stuff done, this is the phone for you. Especially if you want a physical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Willie Alexander Sierra Mencia

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Staying Productive
customer_reviews.text: I love the Key2 phone. Was upgrading from a Priv that had gotten very slow and needed frequent charging. I was worried that the screen would seem too small but that's not been an issue. It feels good in your hands and is fairly "clicky" when you type. Speed and camera quality is far superior to the Priv. The battery life is amazing. I couldn't get the fingerprint detection to work but don't plan on using it that way. Overall I'm very satisfied with my purchase. I use my phone more as a tool than a toy.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Expected
customer_reviews.text: I missed having a physical keyboard. Other than that the phone feels very sturdy and the battery life is enough to get you through almost 2 days with moderate to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Antonio Anguiano

customer_reviews.title: It's really a great device with a phenomenal battery
customer_reviews.text: I am a former Passport SE user and held off for the longest time before swItching to Key2. I am really liking my purchase. Love the productivity tab. Miss the fluidity of BB10 and adapting to the àndriod operating system. Highly recommend Key2.
customer_reviews.author: T. Michael Morrissey

customer_reviews.title: This is not blackberry plus
customer_reviews.text: Buyer be beware: My phone is not working i called Blackberry Plus and they said the IMEI number is not theirs. it is a reseller from India named optiemus and they will not service the phone. the IMEI number starts with 9116 and their should start with O1. I tried calling Optiemus and the number does not. Amazon is selling this being transparent
customer_reviews.author: wendy hummer

customer_reviews.title: Much better upgrade from the KeyOne
customer_reviews.text: Got this after 2 years with the KeyOne. Much better upgrade. Quality, speed, and keyboard size are the first things you'd notice from the KeyOne. Only downside it's not a Passport.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Everything is great but the camera/video for work
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this phone is great but the camera. I would have kept it, but the camera is so bad that video chat/ webinars are terrible. They can't hear me well or see me well. If the can fix this, I'll but the next one
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy1210

customer_reviews.title: Comes with a European (Type C) plug
customer_reviews.text: I would expect that a US seller of phones intended for a US network would make sure that the phones came with a plug for US electrical systems. Unless I lug around an adapter, this phone is useless to me once the battery runs down.
customer_reviews.author: Green Monster

customer_reviews.title: Avoid.
customer_reviews.text: Fell less than a foot on its corner and the screen scattered No screen repair shop wants to touch this phone since they are not use to it. Avoid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone with Long Lasting Battery
customer_reviews.text: We love our BB KeyTwo's! I have had BB's for years and this one is really great! So easy to use. Love the keyboard! The battery goes on and on, which is a wonderful feature!
customer_reviews.author: Claire

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Love having physical keyboard. Although the screen is smaller than some phones I do not notice the difference. Have now had the phone for about a year. Do not regret purchase at all. The greatness of BlackBerry running on Android. Great iPhone alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade from KeyOne
customer_reviews.text: Love this phone. Was an iPhone user for years and wanted a break from iOS. So I bought the KeyOne. During a trip the phone stopped working so upgraded to the Key2. I see a big difference in design and weight and.
customer_reviews.author: Jose

customer_reviews.title: Best all around phone for those who want a PHONE!
customer_reviews.text: Best all around phone I've owned. Solid, classy, and very functional. I don't watch movies or play games on the phone, so screen size was never an issue. Wish it worked with Verizon.
customer_reviews.author: MaxxAxe

customer_reviews.title: BlackBerry is back!!
customer_reviews.text: This new BlackBerry Key2 is amazing. Well built and beautiful to look at. Glad I decided to upgrade from my Keyone. BlackBerry is definitely back!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PHONE!!! HORRIBLE AT&T SERVICE!
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the extended battery life and the intuitive experience with the overall system. However, my experience with AT&T service has always been horrible. I have to leave outside my apartment to get a signal. Needless to say, I will be returning the phone as always dropping calls and absolutely need a reliable service for my business. I hope the makers of the next Blackberry will get it right on the next round and offer the service through VERIZON!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The phone is just beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: The phone is just exactly what I wanted but it started acting weird after a week of usage... The screen flickered on and off making it impossible to use and then I got a black screen for 5 hours... then it came back to life. I am scared of blocking the device...
customer_reviews.author: Inkish Kingdoms

customer_reviews.title: awesome phone
customer_reviews.text: The Key2 fixes what little was wrong with KeyOne. Removing buttons from left side was great. The extra spacing on the keyboard was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Alden

customer_reviews.title: Product shipped with European plug
customer_reviews.text: I am a loyal Blackberry user so the Key 2 is a satisfactory replacement for the Keyone I had that fell and resulted in a broken screen. When i went to charge the new Key2 purchased from Amazon, I saw that the plug sent was a European plug and not an American plug. Not good. However, since I had a Keyone that i would no longer use, i could use the American plug to charge the new phone.
customer_reviews.author: MJI

customer_reviews.title: Great phone for polyglotes and world trotters, it works everywhere...
customer_reviews.text: It is not better than the Torch and PRIV thathe symbols have retractable keyboards, but it works great. Should be whitier, it is hard to type a comma or question mark in the dark unless you memorize them.
customer_reviews.author: Queen of the Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not much of an upgrade from keyone
customer_reviews.text: I came from a BlackBerry keyone I don't notice a whole lot of differences between the two other than the speed key. The keys are a little bit easier to type on because I have large fingers. Other than that no big differences just a good phone as was my keyone .
customer_reviews.author: NO TIME TO SHOP!

customer_reviews.title: Keyboard is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I've had the blackberry 8700, curve, the bold, most recently the Porsche design, so I have been a loyal blackberry customer since 2005. The key 2 is BY FAR the best blackberry ever. They utilized the keyboard to the max and very happy about the operating system; very smooth and fluid. I would highly recommend this phone if you are a blackberry diehard or even if you are tired of the redundant nature of the iPhone/ galaxy. No complaints. Perfect for business with a little bit of pleasure on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Big Heff

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: best one since the bold. keyboard is amazing, speedkey is great. has nice weight and feels good in the hand
customer_reviews.author: DSquares

customer_reviews.title: Diehard Blackberry Fan
customer_reviews.text: It is slightly lighter than the first one which is great, the fingerprint is better on this one and camera is great. Battery hasn't moved lower at all and I've been adding all sorts of apps and downloading huge music collection from my google music account. I swear by Blackberry and this one did not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: kathleen ivers

customer_reviews.title: This blackberry exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I can't find anything that I don't like about it yet. I previously owned several blackberry phones and like there security safety features.
customer_reviews.author: Jabez1

customer_reviews.title: The best blackberry I've owned.
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard is leaps above the KeyONE. OS is smooth and lag free. Portrait mode photos are awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Neil B

customer_reviews.title: Sick phone! Love it. Keep making them!
customer_reviews.text: Camera is worse than Priv (at long distance and zoom) but this phone rocks! Fast, no lag, high quality material and perfect keyboard. Long battery life. Love this phone! Will enjoy for years to come!
customer_reviews.author: UB

customer_reviews.title: Cost 2x what I paid for on in January and it was the best deal.
customer_reviews.text: A good phone ,with a good camera, I need a keyboard so i have a limited number of phones to choose from Last one just froze up and will not turn back on. Quality of these blackberry is not as good as the older ones .
customer_reviews.author: robert la cour

customer_reviews.title: I love the keyboard.
customer_reviews.text: I love my key2! If you want to stand out! Get this phone. It's not the phone for everyone but it fits me perfect! I've been a BlackBerry user from the beginning and I will continue to be one!
customer_reviews.author: Bobby S

customer_reviews.title: Great keyboard, great for work
customer_reviews.text: I preordered he Blackberry Key2 and have been using it for about a month and a half. I am very happy about battery life and the keyboard is a deligth to use. I was used to a 5.5" screen, i do not actually miss the larger screen unless when i watch a movie.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: A must for the BlackBerry devotees.
customer_reviews.text: So you know, I’ve always been a BlackBerry user. I was disappointed when BlackBerry moved away from continued development of their OS and a bit wary of moving to an Android based phone but it is everything I enjoyed about my other BlackBerry phones and more.
customer_reviews.author: GMo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy a key board. Did like the keyone build better but it's much more powerful.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Kiick

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the Priv on several points
customer_reviews.text: The camera in the Priv was superb - it is not in Key 2. The keyboard is not as easy to use and it takes the space that the Priv used for a big chunk of the screen. The transfer of files from the Priv via Google Drive was simple but it took ages. So, I regret very much that rather than improving the Priv (e.g., better battery life and faster processor), BB decided on a whole new design with several features that are inferior to the Priv and other smartphones on the market. Still, if you are a BB fan, it is OK.
customer_reviews.author: Freshwater revivalist

customer_reviews.title: Great Phone !
customer_reviews.text: BRAND NEW PHONE. I love it. Local service provider set it up with data plan and I was up and running with good strength signal in no time. Latest patch took less than 30 seconds to download and install right at the sales shop. Keyboard is a little more spaced out than my last Blackberry so it is easier to type. Very customizable phone to boot. Setting up screens with the icons I want greatly reduces clutter.
customer_reviews.author: BeruBooks

customer_reviews.title: Great modern Blackberry
customer_reviews.text: It was great to finally get modern well maid android operated Blackberry with physical keyboards. Battery lasts longer than anything I used since old Nokia in the 90s. And first great Fingerprint Reader that really works and is in convenient location.
customer_reviews.author: heikki warma

customer_reviews.title: So Happy I Ditched the iPhone and went with Blackberry
customer_reviews.text: The Key2 is a game changer. Security, Security and Security. Much better then my iPhone
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Key 2  Great Phine
customer_reviews.text: while I really dislike a larger phone, feels like carrying a computer tablet w/ me, this is a nice phone. Still love the key board! Am not wild abut the OS but it's the way of the world. for that fact don't like Apples OS either so it wouldn't matter.
customer_reviews.author: ralphine

customer_reviews.title: Wi-fi calling will not work
customer_reviews.text: Wi-fi calling on the Key2 is not provisioned by T-Mobile and does not work. Spent quite a bit of time with the T-MoTech Support to figure it out - but no luck. Unless TCL/Blackberry perform an update and get Wi-fi calling to provision with the Sim card, it is not going to work. Sad! Great phone, I liked the form factor and the hardware is good.
customer_reviews.author: Lucky

customer_reviews.title: Leave your expensive smart phone on the side somewhere whilst as vigorous exercise play.
customer_reviews.text: This purchase was a somewhat emergency purchase. The previous device went kaput having dropped off of my belt clip playing with my nieces and nephew at the local park playground.
customer_reviews.author: Chas_in

customer_reviews.title: keyboard and symbols
customer_reviews.text: I loved the phone however I believe they can do a better job with the keyboard. the shape of the keys makes it easier for finger to slip and type the wrong key. Also, getting to the most used symbols is a little annoying. Numbers and question marks, exclamation marks should be the first to come up when i click on symbol key to make it easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Blackberry
customer_reviews.text: great phone for anyone looking to use as business phone
customer_reviews.author: daniel hanna

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: The phone has more than lived up to my expectations. I bought this one because it was over $200 less than the one for my country. I was concerned because the Indian version hasn't received an update since the end of 2018. It was very easy to download an up to date autoloader and install that. The spacebar/fingerprint reader is very soft, compared to my KeyOne, but hardly a bother.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Received the wrong color
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this device it's perfect! Although, I ordered the silver key2 and for some reason received a black one. Must have been a mixup on amazons part. But great device!!! Recommend to everyone and anyone
customer_reviews.author: Camille

customer_reviews.title: Double click Prower Button emergency call problem
customer_reviews.text: Great product in general, the problem is that if by accident you double click the power button, it calls the emergency services, and the explenatio is that it is an Indian Version. Be aware!
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Serrano M

customer_reviews.title: Oh yeah.
customer_reviews.text: Long time BlueBerry user, this is the best one ever. Arrived perfect. No complaints at all. Gets lots of comments as it looks different than the stuff typical folks have.
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: A great phone with an excellent physically keyboard
customer_reviews.text: I have no complaints about this phone. It works great. As per my experience using it it seems there a large amount of people out there that will like to go back to a physical keyboard.
customer_reviews.author: Eudel C.

customer_reviews.title: Google requires too much access to your personal things!
customer_reviews.text: I like the ability to use all the functions of my phone! I don't like Google and every app requiring full access to your pics and contacts or you can't use the app.
customer_reviews.author: Neednu22

customer_reviews.title: Love this phone. Went from key one to this
customer_reviews.text: Loving this phone so far. Loving the added portrait mode in the camera. Love the new keyboard very big improvement over the keyone keyboard. It's a smooth running phone the screen looks crisp. I'm glad I ordered this as soon as it was available. Update 30 July 2018. I can not be happier I love how fast this phone is. I'm already hopeful for the key3 this is my favourite mobile to date. Well worth the £ if you love a psychical keyboard or blackberry from the past. I would highly recommend picking this up you will not regret it.
customer_reviews.author: William B

customer_reviews.title: Blackberry forever.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with my keytwo! I highly recommend keytwo!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The phone is missing  SIM CARD
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the Blackberry Key2 product. It is missing SIM CARD the second time around. Very very very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Godwin Odiye

customer_reviews.title: Nice step from KEYone
customer_reviews.text: Keyboard def better, another amazing battery, speed key is sweet, updated OS, great styling and feel. Another solid BlackBerry device from TCL.
customer_reviews.author: JD Neill

customer_reviews.title: One flaw
customer_reviews.text: I love this phone except wifi calling no longer works. This is important to me as I have a country home with no cellular service and have always depended on wifi calling. There are all sorts of work arounds posted, but do not seem to work for me. I think it depends on your software version, but I can't step back.
customer_reviews.author: Maurine A. Haver

customer_reviews.title: Broke quickly, no warranty
customer_reviews.text: The headphone jack broke almost immediately, and it seems there is no warranty. Buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Dirk Druet

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Everything was going on ok until my spacebar started acting spam had to press it hard for a space to come between words. Made my typing a bit difficult. I've had it for about 10 months now. The video quality is not so great. Videos are a bit dark especially if the area is not very well Lit even when the camera light is on it still doesn't make a difference
customer_reviews.author: Deidrian C.

customer_reviews.title: wifi
customer_reviews.text: At first had problems with wifi connections but after update no more problems
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: cannot charge after couple months use
customer_reviews.text: I bought key2 when it came out. Everything were fine until yesterday. I found this phone is unable to be charged. The battery level is stopped at ~84% after overnight charging. I restarted the phone, but the problem remains...
customer_reviews.author: Shoujun Gu

customer_reviews.title: Could not open the SIM tray
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. I am sure I would have liked it if I could have got the SIM card tray to open......
customer_reviews.author: B.S.H.Horse

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping- Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: Product came very quickly and in perfect condition. Love this phone even more than I thought I was going to. Perfect for Blackberry lovers. Keyboard and finger print scanner are phenomenal. Not the fastest phone, but plenty fast enough. Great product, Great seller.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Beck

customer_reviews.title: It Computes Without Dispute
customer_reviews.text: I'm addicted crack(berry). I've been addicted since my BlackBerry Pearl.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded from the Keyone. Definitely worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing phone. Upgraded from the keyone and the keyboard alone is worth the upgrade! Battery is great, feels solid and looks perfect. You will not regret upgrading!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Blackberry fanboy
customer_reviews.text: Been a BlackBerry user since 2005. And no regrets whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Emilio H.

customer_reviews.title: Speed and ease of operation. BlackBerry Key2 is the best smart phone ever.
customer_reviews.text: Its cute design and size. The all black version looks amazing. The option to add additional memory with a SD Card is a a great feature.
customer_reviews.author: Prince

customer_reviews.title: Spacebar issues
customer_reviews.text: The phone is great but the spacebar has me kind of worried. The spacebar is loose and rattles when it's tapped / brushed against. I hope it's an issue unique to my device.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hullibarger

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Custromer Satisfaction
customer_reviews.text: The Phone arrived on time, and the thing I like the most about Go Talk, was that they said: "used - like new" I say This phone was brand new because it doesnt even have a scracth on it.
customer_reviews.author: Fabio

customer_reviews.title: Excellent smart phone. Very stable
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product by Blackberry. Much more stable than previous version (prior to Key1) that didn’t have physical keyboard. Battery life is excellent— comparable with iPhone
customer_reviews.author: Todd Fasanella

customer_reviews.title: Long battery life
customer_reviews.text: So far love everything about this phone other than logging into google.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Knight

customer_reviews.title: A great phone.
customer_reviews.text: The phone is fast. The keyboard is great. The camera is excellent. Simply a great phone.
customer_reviews.author: Don Perkal

customer_reviews.title: Blackberry fan...
customer_reviews.text: There is a blue line I m out of usa fot the a next 30 days im not able to recieve a replacement. Seller is not able to change my device even Im willing to pay both shipping
customer_reviews.author: Raul Rincon

customer_reviews.title: Amazing phone!
customer_reviews.text: Fastest phone I've ever had. Love this phone! battery life is amazing! I would definitely recommend to others!
customer_reviews.author: Ruan

customer_reviews.title: Bold,Black&Beautiful.
customer_reviews.text: Finally a phone for a man,this phone is simplistic,durable & fun to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great device, small issues with navigation buttons
customer_reviews.text: Everything is great except for the placement of the navigation buttons (they're not on the screen) and can be hit by accident when trying to press a word prediction.
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: ... us a brand new phone to work with it's awesome and I love that it's on Android platform thank ...
customer_reviews.text: Thanks so much for giving us a brand new phone to work with it's awesome and I love that it's on Android platform thank you
customer_reviews.author: Law4art

customer_reviews.title: WiFi calling
customer_reviews.text: Great phone except the WiFi calling feature was deactivated at the factory level. Don't know why. do you?
customer_reviews.author: JVL

product_meta.title: BlackBerry KEY2 Black Unlocked GSM Android Smartphone 4G LTE, 64GB
product_meta.description: Color:BlackThe all-new BlackBerry Key2 delivers an iconic smartphone experience unlike any other, embracing the heritage of BlackBerry that includes the most intelligent keyboard ever all in the most Secure Android smartphone. Compatible U.S. Carriers: AT&T, T-Mobile, Cricket, MPC, Tracfone, Straight Talk, NET10 Wireless, Iowa Wireless, Simple Mobile, H2O Wireless, Viaero Wireless. Battery-Compatible with USB Power Delivery 2.0 v1.2 & 9V2A 18W QC3.0 Chargers
feature_bullets: Redesigned smart keyboard with speed key, touch navigation, flick typing for faster predictive text, customizable shortcuts and embedded fingerprint sensor
Durable Series 7 aluminum alloy frame, textured diamond grip non-slip back, impact-resistant frame with stunning 4.5-inch touch screen display with Corning Gorilla glass protection
6GB RAM/64GB ROM, micro SD (up to 256GB), 3500 mAh battery with quick charge 3.0; powered by Qualcomm Snapdragon 660 processor with faster LTE for Super-fast file sharing
100% Android with latest Android 8.1 Oreo with access to over a million apps and services from Google play, GSM Unlocked (AT&T, T-Mobile), DTEK by BlackBerry security monitoring

12MP + 12MP dual real camera with dual tone LED flash, portrait mode, optical superzoom, 4K video recording; 8MP fixed focus front camera with selfie flash, 1080p video recording.Dual Sim.Bluetooth 5.0

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars436 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: USB 2.0 Cable, Bat-cov cling, QSG, 3A Headset, SIM tray tool, Charger, SBI, Front cling
